decks.notes: The deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the pace of the game. By using cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will, as well as efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent while keeping their own board state intact. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Daze also helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy and prevent them from stabilizing, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By combining the speed and disruption of cards like Daze and Force of Will with the powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence, ultimately leading to victory through a ruthless combination of combo and reanimation strategies.

The deck focuses on using efficient low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to control the board while quickly building up resources through card draw with Brainstorm and Ponder. The main win condition is to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath is included for additional value and card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Stifle and Force of Will to protect its game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes powerful dual lands like Tropical Island and Volcanic Island.

This deck focuses on quickly casting powerful creatures and spells with Cascade, overwhelming opponents with a mix of aggressive threats and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Crashing Footfalls, the deck aims to cascade into high-impact spells like Violent Outburst to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. With a mix of efficient creatures, counterspells, and land destruction, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock to close out the game.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive cards. By locking down the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void, while also ramping up aggressive creatures such as Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss, this deck can quickly take over the game. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Shatterskull Smashing and The One Ring ensure that the deck can close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to recover.

The deck focuses on generating large amounts of mana quickly through lands like Ancient Tomb and Crystal Vein to cast powerful creatures like Maelstrom Wanderer and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It also utilizes Creative Technique to tutor for key combo pieces and Sakashima's Protege to copy important creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and high mana production, leading to a quick victory. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Boarding Party and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect the combo and control the game.

The deck focuses on using a combination of mana acceleration and fast spells to quickly mill through the library and win the game by finding and playing Thassa's Oracle. The deck uses various forms of card advantage and protection to ensure the combo can go off as efficiently and consistently as possible, while also utilizing reanimation cards to potentially bring back key combo pieces if needed. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and combo off before the opponent has a chance to respond, leading to a swift victory.

This control deck focuses on disrupting opponents while slowly building up its own board presence. The deck has a range of removal spells and counterspells to control the game, with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters to finish off the opponent. The deck also utilizes land destruction with Wasteland to disrupt mana bases. The key strategy is to maintain control of the game through disruption and removal spells, while slowly grinding out a win with its powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the deck quickly and win with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck includes interaction with Force of Will and Cabal Therapy, as well as card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption against opposing decks, while Stoneforge Mystic can search for equipment like Shuko to assist in the combo. The deck also includes a control element with Orim's Chant and Daze to protect the combo.
